remarks: This lemma proves that there exists a function ` x ` as in the proof in [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 91, after Lemma 2: x_j is in the subalgebra, 0 <= x_j <= 1, x_j < ε / n on A_j (meaning A in the paper), x_j > 1 - \epslon / n on B_j.  Here ` D ` is used to represent A in the paper (because A is used for the subalgebra of functions), ` E ` is used to represent ε.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
